title: A Day at the Zoo
templates: There is a {adjective} kid named {custom-kid-name}. One day, {custom-kid-name} decided to visit the {adjective} zoo.
At the zoo, the first thing {custom-kid-name} saw was a {adjective} {animal} eating {food-plural}.
Next, {custom-kid-name} saw a {adjective} {animal} that was {ing-verb} with a {noun-singular}. {custom-kid-name} laughed and said "That's the most {adjective} thing I've ever seen!"

The most {adjective} part of the day was when a {adjective} {animal} escaped from its enclosure. Everyone {past-verb} in surprise. The zookeepers used a {noun-singular} to coax it back into its home.
Finally, tired but {emotion}, {custom-kid-name} went home and {past-verb} into bed.

title: A Bird in the Neighborhood
templates: There is a {adjective} bird in our neighborhood that sits on a {noun-singular} and sings.
During the day people love to hear the {adjective} bird singing. It makes my pet {animal} feel jealous.
However, during the night the bird does not stop singing! People are trying to {present-verb} and sleep so they become {emotion} and throw {plural-noun} at the bird.
